name: synthetically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
using processes or materials that are not found in nature: synthetically produced vitamins
in a way that seems false or not natural: Their harmony singing was flawless, almost synthetically so. See
synthetic
More examplesFewer examplesThat means the nutrients have been stripped out and replaced synthetically. This jewel-like effect is lacking in rugs with synthetically dyed yarns. Synthetically produced fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides used by conventional farmers are subject to extensive regulation. Previously, naturally derived vitamin E was rated 30% more active than synthetically derived vitamin E.
